DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a person has a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured in size as information that can be used to judge response to treatment as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured in size as information that can be used to judge response to treatment as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Measurable_Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator relating to the results of an assessment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: Report; a short account.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The desired information is not available.

Concepts.definition: The desired information is not available.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have measurable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease defined as at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest dimension to be recorded) using RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable or assessable disease defined as at least one of the following: A lymph node or tumor mass that is >=2.0 cm in at least one dimension by CT portion of PET/CT, CT or MRI. Diffuse infiltration of an organ such as the stomach, bone marrow, peripheral blood, liver, lungs or bowel by lymphoma without a discrete mass would constitute assessable, but not measurable, disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet the disease status requirement

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease allowed (see Section 11.21for definition of measurable disease).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease by RECIST

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable Disease per RECIST 1.1 and a Site Targetable for Radiotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least one target lesion to be used to assess response on this protocol as defined by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease with at least one target lesion as defined by RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does this patient have measurable disease as defined by RECIST 1.1 meaning at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest diameter to be recorded)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subjects must have measurable disease based on RECIST 1.1, defined as at least 1 lesion that can be accurately measured in at least 1 dimension (>=10 mm longest diameter for non-nodal lesions and or >=15 mm short axis for nodal lesions) by spiral CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: Cohort expansion phase: Does patient have measurable lesions as defined by RECIST version 1.1 criteria?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cohort expansion phase: Does patient have measurable lesions as defined by RECIST version 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subjects must have measurable disease based on RECIST 1.1, defined as at least 1 lesion that can be accurately measured in at least 1 dimension (>=10 mm longest diameter for non-nodal lesions and or >=15 mm short axis for nodal lesions) by spiral CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subjects must have measurable disease assessed  by caliper measurement or CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have measurable disease per RECIST 1.1, assessed by CT scan, or for skin lesions not measurable by CT scan, measurements may be performed with caliper or flexible ruler.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the combined tumor diameter >=4cm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text_10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has three lesions with no lesion greater than 6cm in greatest dimension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least one measurable target extracranial lesion according to RECIST 1.1

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease, documented by clinical, radiographic, or histologic criteria as defined by RECIST v1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Patient has measurable disease, as defined by RECIST v1.1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has measurable disease, as defined by RECIST v1.1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable Disease per RECIST v1.1 by Computer Tomography (CT) Scan or Magnetic Imaging (MRI)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable Disease based on RECIST 1.1 including at least two cancerous deposits.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet the disease status requirement?
